name: Drawings & Revision No. used to check off Pre Pour Inspection:
Independent Survey – Check off critical survey points
Pre-Pour Checked and Accepted – HOLD POINT – Site Engineer & Engineer’s Rep to sign
Mandrels drawn through all ducts to verify no leakage / disconnection
Finished Level: Finished to grout check / angle fillet worked to
Surface to required finish eg U2, U4
Retarder applied at end of the pour
Blow holes, tie bar holes filled
Inspection of surface/s & any authorised repairs have been completed
The above works have been inspected and on the basis of this check sheet are considered compliant with the drawings, specifications and instructions.
FHIMS-QA-6006 - Insitu Concrete - Process Control Plan PRR
template name: FHIMS-QA-6006 - Insitu Concrete - Process Control Plan PRR

name: HOLD POINT: Control Checklist - Fall Prevention (if applicable). Notify Worksafe NZ if required. Ensure all necessary Permit to Works & Controlled Checklists are in place
RECORDS: Permit attached or permit number noted
METHODS OR REFERENCE: Is the Work Instruction for this work complete?
METHODS OR REFERENCE: Relevant non conformance of previous work signed off
HOLD POINT: Relevant parties to inspect and review
METHODS OR REFERENCE: Ensure that Design is approved and Drawings are of the latest revision
METHODS OR REFERENCE: Concrete mix design(s) submitted and approved by Design Engineer
HOLD POINT: Check concrete mix design status
METHODS OR REFERENCE: All concrete delivered to site shall be produced in accordance with the approved mix design
METHODS OR REFERENCE: Steel reinforcement complys with drawings, specifications and standards
HOLD POINT: Steel reinforcing conforms to drawings and specification
RECORDS: Detail Sheets and Mill Certificates
METHODS OR REFERENCE: Any welding or mechanical splicing to be approved in writing by the Design Engineer
FREQUENCY: Prior to welding or splicing
RECORDS: Mark Up As Built Drawings
METHODS OR REFERENCE: Any reinforcement modifications (cutting or bending) on site to be approved in writing by the Design Engineer
FREQUENCY: Prior to cutting or bending on site
RECORDS: Mark Up As Built Drawings
METHODS OR REFERENCE: Approval given by engineer's Rep and Signed off Subgrade Approval Checksheet
HOLD POINT: Inspection and Acceptance of Structure Foundations
METHODS OR REFERENCE: Set out design features as per IFC drawings (Cast in items, Ducting, Penetrations)
HOLD POINT: Consistency with Construction Drawing
METHODS OR REFERENCE: Once blinding concrete layer has been completed the Engineer's Rep to inspect and give approval for the rest of the works to commence
METHODS OR REFERENCE: Formwork to be constructed to design and set to correct line and level as set out by the surveyor
METHODS OR REFERENCE: The Site Engineer and must sign off the formwork prior to concrete being poured
METHODS OR REFERENCE: Reinforcing steel shall be handled, placed and fixed as per NZS 3109
METHODS OR REFERENCE: Check for any cast in items and ensure they are fixed correctly
METHODS OR REFERENCE: Waterstop and Hydrophilic placement checks to ensure correct placement including welds
METHODS OR REFERENCE: Ensure the Permit to Concrete Pump Checksheet has been completed before concrete pumping commences
METHODS OR REFERENCE: The Design Engineer shall be advised at least 24 working hours before the proposed time for concreting that a pre-pour inspection is required
METHODS OR REFERENCE: Concrete dockets checked for correct mix and concrete site testing undertaken. 1 slump test per truck. 1 sample set per 75m3 of each different mix
METHODS OR REFERENCE: Concrete surfaces shall be F4 or better for formed surfaces and U3 or better for unformed surfaces
METHODS OR REFERENCE: Curing and thermal monitoring
METHODS OR REFERENCE: Review concrete compressive tests results
METHODS OR REFERENCE: Remove formwork as per the approved work method
METHODS OR REFERENCE: Ensure all OFIs are closed and included within QA file
METHODS OR REFERENCE: The Concrete Test Result Spreadsheet and Test reports to be included within QA file
METHODS OR REFERENCE: Delivery Dockets to be included in QA file
METHODS OR REFERENCE: Red pen mark up drawings to be included in QA file
FREQUENCY: At the completion of the Lot of work
